title: Bug 17825 ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI
description: The bug report mentions unexpected beeping sounds in ControlExampleText when selecting SWT.MULTI.
OB: When choosing SWT.MULTI in ControlExampleText, a Windows 'ding' sound (indicating an error) is heard.
EB: The expected behavior is that selecting SWT.MULTI should not produce a 'ding' sound.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Use Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K. 
2. Open the SWT example ControlExample. 
3. Navigate to the Text tab. 
4. Click on Styles SWT.SINGLE and then switch back to Styles SWT.MULTI. This should trigger the unexpected 'ding' sound.
